reviews.title: Beautiful Grounds
reviews.text: The grounds of this hotel is beautiful, the rooms are big and very nice as well as the garden suite. I've stayed at Posada San Javier 4 times and I would recommend it to anyone. My husband and I always stay in the best hotels and to me this is in par. The only problem I find is the location, to get to town the fastest is by taxi, or take the 20 minute walk. So if you plan on staying one night in Guanjuato I would recommend a hotel near the Jardin (town square), but if you plan on staying a few days, I highly recommend Posada San Javier.

spent a weekend at the hotel, built into an old hacienda, nice setting, but rooms in the main (modern built) block (as most of the rooms) are a bit small, and what is not good, no opening window, no balcony (only ground floor have a terace), no coffee free of charge, no outdoor restaurant or bar, a bit a pity in the pleasant climate in Guanajuato, swimming pool is just a pond, bed comforable, room was quiet, quite near centre (about 10 min with taxis) not bad in total, is convenient, but lacks a bit of atmoshpere one could expect in the marvelous town of Guanajuato.
reviews.title: Conventient, but lacks a bit of atmosphere

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I decided to go to Guanajuato after visiting San Miguel de Allende. And what a dissapointment!!!! After staying at a wonderful hotel (Antigua Capilla) with exceptional service, we encountered the front desk ladies at the Camino Real...Beware of JULIANNA...she can be pretty annoying and lacking any training at customer service...
reviews.title: Beware of the service

reviews.text: I made my reservations through Bestday.com on September and requested a king size bed...when we got the hotel JULIANNA told me she didn't have king size beds and the hotel was too full to help me out....Probably it was a mistake from the travel agency, but this girl has NO clue on dealing with customers, she even rolled up her eyes at me when I asked her what could she do to help us out....
reviews.title: Nice Room - Bar Service was terrible

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There were also a lot of kids running around, yelling and making noise through the aisles...The acoustic is terrible, and door seem to be made of paper since you can hear what the people at the aisle are talking...
reviews.title: Should have an adult only section..

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The beds are TOO soft...´We were there just a week ago and my husband's back is still hurting... It so funny most people complaint (at mexican hotels) is the hardess of the matresses...well, this is not the case...
reviews.title: Fled after 4 sleepless night!

likes.disliked: — too expensive and too noisey ...we could not sleep

reviews.title: okay.
reviews.text: we just came back. we were there the last week of july 2004. we made our way to parador san javier from san miguel allende. i was recommend this hotel from a local friend who lives in guanajuato. i was not pleased with the hotel rooms. the food was okay. the restaurant is beautiful but the food is okay. yes, it does have beautiful gardens but the rooms i thought were a bit dingy. our room had an old musty smell to it. it was not worth the $90 or so a night that we paid. i think there are better choices at the plaza where everything is close. it was far from the central plaza for a walk. a cab ride to the plaza will cost you $3 each way. so i would recommend that we stay in the plaza where all the restaurants are and the music and all the fun. this hotel just has a nice appearance to it from the outside. but the rooms i think are not worth the $90-110 a night. i though that was a bit high for the quality of the rooms. i would rate this like a three star hotel.

reviews.title: San Javier: Nice hotel and very kid friendly
reviews.text: The San Javier was a good vacation for the money. It was a very kid friendly environment (more so than some of the other nice hotels we walked through while we were there). We went in May, which is low season and a great time to go so there are no crowds.
1. The beds were hard, but this is how all hotel beds are in Mexico.
reviews.title: Not your typical Howard Johnson's!
Great hotel- don't buy the ceramics
reviews.text: 2. There was very little hot water in the shower, but the pressure was good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I wanted to spend a couple of days in Guanajuato while our daughter stayed with grandpas. It worked fine for us.
reviews.title: Worked fine for a gateaway. A little overpriced.
This Hotel is Awful
reviews.text: I picked this hotel for its location. It’s out of the busy downtown area but still in short distance. Our main objective was to relax. We normally walked to downtown (10 minutes walk down the hill) and came back in taxi. We loved to walk around Guanajuato.
The room had plenty of space and everything work fine. No problems at all in our room. The room and hotel was very peaceful.
reviews.title: Too bad for a new hotel

likes.liked: — the hotel is in a really nice
likes.disliked: — elevators didn't work and had to go to the 6th floor by stairs

reviews.text: The breakfast was OK but comparing with other Mexican hotels the food variety was limited but much better that any American motel such as La Quinta or Hampton.
reviews.title: El mejor de Guanax

likes.liked: — frente al teatro juarez en el centro esta un restaurant realmente bueno

reviews.title: A nice place to stay
reviews.text: We went one night to the hotel bar but it was too simple. It was not fun or romantic.
